'''Riolu''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''リオル''' ''Riolu'') is a {{type|Fighting}} [[baby Pokémon]] introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Lucario}} when [[level]]ed up with high [[friendship]] during the [[Time|day]].

==Biology==
Riolu is a small, blue, canine Pokémon. It has black legs and torso, a blue tail, and a yellow collar. It has rounded bumps on the backs of its forepaws. It has a black "mask" and red eyes. It stands on its toes instead of its entire foot. It is sensitive to a special type of energy called [[Aura]]; however, It does not have the ability to fully use these powers, although it can still emanate these waves to communicate and sense them, albeit only in ripples. Like almost all Fighting-type Pokémon, Riolu naturally has superhuman strength, stamina, and endurance and is capable of making long journeys on foot in a short amount of time. It is a playful, energetic, and loyal Pokémon.

==In the anime==
[[File:Cameron Riolu.png|thumb|220px|left|Riolu in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Aura Sphere Riolu]]====
Riolu debuted in ''[[DP071|Pokémon Ranger and the Kidnapped Riolu! Parts One]] [[DP072|and Two]]''. This Riolu had been trained to use {{m|Aura Sphere}} and was unnaturally strong. It was taken away from the lab by [[J's henchmen]] that wanted to exploit it but {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}} returned it to [[Lucario Kingdom|its kingdom]], with [[Kellyn]]'s help. This Riolu developed a strong bond with {{Ash}}.

====[[Cameron's Riolu]]====
A {{TP|Cameron|Riolu}} appeared in ''[[BW093|Goodbye, Junior Cup - Hello Adventure!]]'', under the ownership of {{un|Cameron}}. It evolved into a Lucario in ''[[BW107|Cameron's Secret Weapon!]]''.

====[[Korrina's Riolu]]====
Korrina's Riolu, currently a Lucario, appeared in ''[[XY030|Mega Revelations!]]'' in flashback.

===Minor appearances===
A Riolu appeared in {{MTR}}'s [[boss fantasy]] in ''[[DP092|A Lean Mean Team Rocket Machine!]]''.

A Riolu appeared in ''[[PK24|Meloetta's Moonlight Serenade]]''.

Two {{pkmn|Trainer}}s' Riolu appeared in ''[[SM001|Alola to New Adventure!]]'', with one appearing in a flashback.

Two Trainers' Riolu appeared in ''[[SM006|A Shocking Grocery Run!]]''.

A Trainer's Riolu appeared in ''[[SM007|That's Why the Litten is a Scamp!]]''.

A Trainer's Riolu appeared in ''[[SM013|Racing to a Big Event!]]'', where it participated in the Pancake Race.

A Trainer's Riolu appeared in ''[[SM017|Crystal-Clear Sleuthing!]]''.

A Trainer's Riolu appeared in ''[[SM021|One Journey Ends, Another Begins...]]''.

A Trainer's Riolu appeared in ''[[SM023|Getting the Band Back Together!]]''.

A Trainer's Riolu appeared in ''[[SM027|A Glaring Rivalry!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Maylene Riolu Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Riolu in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
[[File:Riley Riolu Egg Adventures.png|thumb|left|150px|A Riolu {{pkmn|Egg}} in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Phantom Thief Pokémon 7 manga===
{{main|Hiori's Riolu}}
In the [[Phantom Thief Pokémon 7]] manga, Hiori's Lucario used to be a Riolu during [[Hiori]] and [[Lily (Pokémon 7)|Lily's]] childhoods.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In ''[[PS356|Magnificent Meditite & Really Riolu I]]'', [[Maylene]] is seen to own a Riolu. He is seen using {{m|Drain Punch}} against {{adv|Pearl}}'s [[Chimler|Monferno]], who {{adv|Platinum}} borrowed in order to fight her. However, in the end, he lost to a well-placed {{m|Mach Punch}} that the girl had perfected by watching slot machines.

In ''[[PS382|Vexing Vespiquen & Unmanageable Mothim II]]'', {{adv|Diamond}} helps protect an {{pkmn|Egg}} containing Riolu from two [[Team Galactic|Galactic]]-hired thugs, and after they are defeated, it hatches and is shown to interact with its {{p|Lucario|evolved form}}. It decided to stay with [[Riley]].

A Trainer's Riolu appeared in ''[[PS423|Tackling Togekiss]]''.

A student's Riolu appeared in ''[[PS530|Movie Panic]]''.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
[[Hareta]] gained a Riolu Egg in ''[[DPA10|Serious Training on Iron Island!!]]'' which hatched into a Riolu later on in that chapter. It has since evolved into a {{p|Lucario}}.

{{main|Riolu (TCG)}}

==Other appearances==
===[[Super Smash Bros. Brawl]]===
Riolu appears as a trophy.

====Trophy information====
''"An Emanation Pokémon. It constantly emits Aura energy. When it's frightened or sad, this energy grows stronger and informs its companions of its situation. It's known for its very flexible yet surpassingly powerful body. Thanks to its strength, it can crest three mountains and cross two canyons in a single night. When it levels up, it evolves into Lucario."''

==Trivia==
* Due to Riolu's combination of Abilities, Steadfast can only activate in {{g|Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness}} and {{g|Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky}} if Riolu becomes {{DL|Seeds|X-Eye Seed|cross-eyed}}, barring being confronted with a foe that has {{a|Mold Breaker}}.
* When Riolu became a starter in {{g|Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky}} it became the first [[starter Pokémon]] to be unable to be recruited or captured in another game of its trio as it cannot be found in [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness|Explorers of Darkness]] without using [[Wonder Mail]].
* Riolu is the only [[baby Pokémon]] that evolves into a Pokémon capable of [[Mega Evolution]].
** Riolu is also the only baby Pokémon introduced after [[Generation II]] that can be bred without requiring one of its parents to be holding an incense.

===Origin===
Riolu appears to be based on the Egyptian god {{wp|Anubis}}, who has the head of a jackal. It may also be based on a {{wp|raccoon}} due to the mask-like markings on its face and its small pointed ears.

====Name origin====
Riolu is ''{{p|Lucario}}'' with the first and last syllables reversed and the ''ca'' omitted.
